videos.name: How to Take User Input in Python? #3
Python for Beginners - 005 | User-input, Data-type Casting and Conversions

exercises.title: Greet user
exercises.content: In this exercise, you will receive the user's name as input and output a greeting like "Welcome, John Smith" You must store the first and last names in different variables
exercises.solution:
first_name = input("What's your first name? ")
last_name = input("What's your last name? ")
print(f"Welcome, {first_name} {last_name}")

exercises.title: User description
exercises.content:
For this exercise, you will get data from a new user and then print a description. You must get the user's

1. First name
2. Last name
3. Birthdate
4. Email

Then, output it in the format John Smith (john.smith@gmail.com) was born on January 1, 1970.
exercises.solution:
first_name = input("First name: ")
last_name = input("Last name: ")
birthdate = input("Birthdate: ")
email = input("Email: ")
print(f"{first_name} {last_name} ({email}) was born on {birthdate}")

exercises.title: Cast types
exercises.content:
You are making a system where employees can enter new items. You must store various details about the product in the appropriate data type. You need to get the

1. Item name
2. Item price
3. Item category (food, electronics, clothing, etc.)
4. Numerical ID

When the user has finished entering all the details, output a message like "<enter_item_name> has been added"
exercises.solution:
name = input("Item name: ")
price = float(input("Price: "))
category = input("Category: ")
id = int(input("Numerical ID: "))

print(f"{name} has been added")
